text: Russian-speaking Ukrainian Nationalists (RUN) ( (РУН)) is a Ukrainian organization founded in the summer of 2013. The meeting of political party "Russian-speaking Ukrainian nationalists.", Korrespondent.net (3 November 2014) RUN is a platform for Russians in Ukraine who are Ukrainian patriots and supporters of Ukrainian independence. A new movement in Ukraine, "Russian- speaking Ukrainian nationalists", Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty (19 April 2013) It has a territorial nationalistic worldview. Run is led by Serhiy Zamilyuhin. All Russian Ukrainian nationalists..., Ukrayinska Pravda (11 September 2015) ==History== The organization is the offspring of a social movement that appeared in the form of groups in social networks and became an NGO in the summer of 2013. RUN stated in November 2014 that it aimed to take part in the October 2015 Ukrainian local elections. But in October 2015 no such party named Russian-speaking Ukrainian Nationalists was registered at the Ukrainian Ministry of Justice. Єдиний реєстр громадських формувань Unified Register of community groups, Ukrainian Ministry of Justice (as viewed on 9 October 2015) In the October 2015 Kiev local election the organization took part as a "non-party" on the election list of the Patriotic Party of Ukraine. We must not allow the oligarchs to fund our party, Korrespondent.net (13 September 2015) ==Ideology and stances== One of the organization's goals is to change the Ukrainian educational system so that children will learn "Russian- Ukrainian" instead of the Russian language since the organization believes the latter one was "historically imposed". New Ukrainian nationalists - Russian speaking, bigmir (19 April 2014) The NGO has handed out pamphlets "to debunk the Soviet myths" about the Ukrainian Insurgent Army (in the summer of 2013). In Ukraine, the growing movement of Russian Banderavyets, Gazeta.ua (July 15, 2013) ==References== ==External links== * Official website Category:2014 establishments in Ukraine Category:Nationalist parties in Ukraine Category:Organizations established in 2014 Category:Russian political parties in Ukraine Category:Russian-Ukrainian culture Category:Russians in Ukraine Category:Ukrainian nationalism
title: Russian-speaking Ukrainian Nationalists
